testTitle: Life in the UK Test - Practice Set 1
testDescription: Official practice questions for the Life in the UK citizenship test covering British history, culture, and government.

questions.stem: In which year did the Battle of Hastings take place?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Hastings took place in 1066, when William the Conqueror defeated King Harold II, leading to the Norman conquest of England.

questions.stem: What is the official currency of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The official currency of the UK is the Pound Sterling (£), also known simply as the pound.

questions.stem: Which of the following are official languages of Wales?
questions.explanation: Both English and Welsh are official languages in Wales. Welsh is a Celtic language that has been spoken in Wales for over 1,400 years.

questions.stem: The UK Parliament consists of the House of Commons and the House of Lords.
questions.explanation: The UK Parliament is bicameral, consisting of two houses: the House of Commons (elected) and the House of Lords (appointed and hereditary peers).

questions.stem: Who wrote the famous novel 'Pride and Prejudice'?
questions.explanation: Jane Austen wrote 'Pride and Prejudice', published in 1813. It is one of the most famous works of English literature.

questions.stem: What is the minimum age to vote in UK general elections?
questions.explanation: The minimum voting age for UK general elections is 18 years old. You must also be registered to vote and be a British, Irish, or Commonwealth citizen.

questions.stem: Which of these cities is the capital of Scotland?
questions.explanation: Edinburgh is the capital city of Scotland and the seat of the Scottish Parliament. Glasgow is Scotland's largest city, but not the capital.

questions.stem: The NHS (National Health Service) was established in which year?
questions.explanation: The NHS was established on 5 July 1948, providing healthcare free at the point of use for all UK residents. It was founded by Health Secretary Aneurin Bevan.
